intro: Eleocharis spegazzinii, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of water bodies. The plant has thin, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered spikelets that are often difficult to distinguish from other rush species. Eleocharis spegazzinii is characterized by its compact growth habit and its ability to thrive in saturated soil conditions. It plays an important ecological role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for aquatic organisms.
